page.title: 11THE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: In the parish of Tedburn there are 10 parish Councillors, elected every 4 years. Meetings are held once a month and are open to the public who are invited to bring their problems and comments. Councillors work closely with the community dealing with a variety of local problems; providing street lighting, lights that don't work, highway maintenance, refuse, environmental, etc. An important part of its work is consultation with the District Council on planning matters. It endeavours to put its case on behalf of the local community before a decision is made. The parish council is involved in road safety committees, Parish Emergency Work, etc. Parish councillors have a pride in their local community and concern for its future. The only paid member is the Clerk.
